title: internal compiler error: fictitious type [type error] in sizing_type_of()

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

body:
I got this while trying to implement something similar to a FromStr trait and tried to rely on a lot of inferencing when calling it. I can try to extract a standalone example if needed.

```
error: internal compiler error: fictitious type [type error] in sizing_type_of()
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: http://doc.rust-lang.org/complement-bugreport.html
note: run with RUST_BACKTRACE=1 for a backtrace
```
